address: The Bombay Art Society, Jehangir Art Gallery, Fort, 161-B, M. G. Road, Kalaghoda, Mumbai 400001
title: The Bombay Art Society
detailsOfAchievement: The Bombay Art Society, a Non- Profit Arts Institution founded in 1888, is one of the oldest art institutions in the Asian Subcontinent promoting visual arts since last 127 years. Considering its yeomen services in the field art, The Bombay Art Society was granted a land at Bandra Reclamation, Mumbai by the State Government where a huge symbol of architectural grandiose has now taken shape consisting of 3 State of Art Galleries, an Auditorium, a Conference Room and a Art Reference Library. This Art Complex was inaugurated on the 13th February, 2016 at the hands of the Honorable Prime Minister of India Shri. Narendra Modi. The Bombay Art Society has also held successful All India Annual Art Exhibitions since past 124 years, creating exhibition platform for deserving artists. During the Annual Art Exhibitions the society also confers awards and scholarships to the artists. The Bombay Art Society is celebrating 125 successful years of holding All India Level Annual Art Exhibition. On this occasion we have planned to hold an exhibition and publish a well researched book titled, The Bombay Art Society : History and Voyage of 128 years. The celebration will be held from 10th February, 2017 to 31st March, 2017 at NGMA, Mumbai.

The Society arranges lectures on science topics of national importance. Besides, the society publishes six monthly magazine titled "Journal of Geoscience Research", comprising various research papers. The Society organises seminars / workshops on topics of scientific importance to encourage publication of research findings and make it available to the geoscience community , in form of publication of special peer reviewed proceedings volume. The Society has till now has organised over ten national seminars viz. Gondwana Geology, Sedimentology, Precambrian Geology ,Energy resources, Ground water and lakes etc. The Society has published 15 special volumes on different geoscience topics.The Society has 675 life members from all over India.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: No funds received from state government. Funds generated from sale of publication and interest on fixed deposit with nationalised banks.

title: THE JIMMY S BILIMORIA FOUNDATION
detailsOfAchievement: PALCARE from The Jimmy S Bilimoria Foundation is recognized as a leading and reputed palliative care service in Mumbai providing a high quality facility and in less than two years it has provided pain management and symptom relief to more than three hundred and twenty five patients eighty percent of whom have passed away and an equal percentage in their homes Many families of patients are referring PALCARE to others in need and many doctors and hospitals are referring their patients to PALCARE

sourceOfFunds.purpose: The Jimmy S Bilimoria Foundation has been set up in Mumbai to provide patients with life limiting conditions particularly cancer patients who are terminal a holistic palliative care service in the comfort of their home Palcare as the service is known is delivered by an interdisciplinary team of specially trained doctors nurses and psychologists and provides pain and symptom management along with psycho social counseling so that patients may live comfortably and in dignity till the very end
